meanings.sent1: The sputtery engine finally started after a few tries.
meanings.sent2: The campfire was sputtery, sending sparks into the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The sputtery popcorn machine added a fun twist to movie night.
meanings.sent4: The sputtery rain on the roof sounded like a drumroll.
meanings.sent5: The sputtery fireworks lit up the dark sky with bursts of light.

meanings.definition: To make a series of short explosive sounds
meanings.sent1: The firecrackers sputtered loudly on New Year's Eve.
meanings.sent2: The bacon sputtered in the hot pan as it cooked.
meanings.sent3: The old radio sputtered to life, playing a nostalgic tune.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks sputtered and crackled in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The candle sputtered out, leaving the room in darkness.

meanings.definition: To speak in a halting or explosive manner
meanings.sent1: She sputtered her apology nervously, trying to explain.
meanings.sent2: The angry customer sputtered complaints to the manager.
meanings.sent3: He sputtered with laughter at the silly joke.
meanings.sent4: The politician sputtered through the difficult questions.
meanings.sent5: The child sputtered out the words, struggling to express himself.
